translated: Moreover, the souls are different, being established as different due to the different arrangements of dharma, pleasure, pain, etc.

analyzed: anyathā hi ekasya dharma adharma ādayaḥ sarvasya bhaveyuḥ
translated: For otherwise, the dharma, adharma, etc. of one would be for all.

analyzed: brahmasiddhi kṛtaḥ matena śaṅkā
translated: The doubt is made by the one who establishes Brahman.

analyzed: kaścid paṇḍita mānī prāha kālpanikī sukha duḥkha ādi vyavasthā bhaviṣyati
translated: Some one proud of his learning says: The arrangement of pleasure, pain, etc. will be imaginary.

analyzed: yathā ekasmin eva śarīre pāda ādi vedanā vyavasthā na vyatikīryate
translated: Just as the experience of the feet, etc. in one body is not mixed up,

original: tathā nānāśarīreṣu na vyatikariṣyata iti /🔽na hi pādagatā vedanā śirasi /
analyzed: tathā nānā śarīreṣu na vyatikariṣyate iti  na hi pāda gatā vedanā śirasi
translated: so it will not be mixed up in different bodies.🔽For the experience in the feet is not in the head,

analyzed: na vā śiraḥ gatā vedanā pāde
translated: nor is the experience in the head in the feet.

original: na ca vedanā pādādiṣveva samavaitītiśakyate vaktum /
analyzed: na ca vedanā pāda ādiṣu eva samavaiti iti śakyate vaktum
translated: And it cannot be said that the experience exists only in the feet and so on,

analyzed: teṣām ajña tvāt
translated: because they are not known.

analyzed: jñātā hi vedanābhiḥ saha sambadhyate
translated: For the knower is connected with feelings together.

analyzed: duḥkha viśeṣa rūpa tvāt tāsām iti
translated: Because they have the nature of specific suffering.

analyzed: tad nirasanam
translated: The refutation of that.

analyzed: tat idam bāla jana mohanam iti
translated: This is a deception of foolish people.

analyzed: vṛddhāḥ
translated: The elders.

analyzed: pāde me vedanā
translated: I have pain in my foot.

original: śirasi me vedaneti sarvavedanāsveko duḥkhī prakāśate /
analyzed: śirasi me vedanā iti sarva vedanāsu ekaḥ duḥkhī prakāśate
translated: I have pain in my head. In all feelings, one suffering person appears.

analyzed: pāda ādiṣu tu santāpa ādikam samavaiti
translated: But in the foot and so on, heat and so on are combined.

analyzed: santāpaḥ tejasā saha saṃyogaḥ
translated: Heat is the conjunction with fire.

original: śūlastu vāyuvā saheti vātapittaśleṣmaṇāṃ kṣobhajeṣu sarveṣu vikāreṣu veditavyam /
analyzed: śūlaḥ tu vāyuvā saha iti vāta pitta śleṣmaṇām kṣobha jeṣu sarveṣu vikāreṣu veditavyam
translated: And pain is with wind. Thus it should be known in all disorders produced by the disturbance of wind, bile and phlegm.

analyzed: acetanānām api pada ādīnām pitta ādi saṃyogaḥ na virudhyate
translated: The connection of the foot and so on, which are insentient, with bile and so on, is not contradictory.

analyzed: duḥkham ātmani eva samavaiti
translated: Suffering is combined only with the self.

analyzed: atha ucyeta yathā pratibimba bhāvaḥ ekasya eva maṇi kṛpāṇa darpaṇa ādi upādhi vaśena
translated: Now, if it is said that just as a reflection is of one thing only, by the power of the limiting conditions such as a jewel, a sword, a mirror, and so on,

analyzed: vyavasthitāni ca śyāma tva ādīni
translated: and the black and so on are established,

analyzed: tathā ekasya ātmanaḥ nānā śarīra upādhi vaśena sukha ādayaḥ vyavatiṣṭhante iti
translated: in the same way, the happiness and so on of one self are established by the power of the limiting conditions of various bodies.

analyzed: tat ayuktam śyāma tva ādīnām aupādhikānām upādhi vaśa varti tvāt vimba sambandha abhāvāt
translated: That is not correct. Because the black and so on, which are adventitious, are subject to the power of the limiting conditions, and there is no connection with the original object.

analyzed: tena eka dharmi dharmāṇām satām eṣā vyavasthā sambhavati
translated: Therefore, this arrangement of the properties of a single substratum is possible.

analyzed: sukha ādayaḥ tu na aupādhikāḥ
translated: But pleasure etc. are not adventitious.

original: kintvātmasamavāyina vyavasthānupapattiḥ /🔽kiñca siddhe vyaktamekatve syādapyeṣā kalpanā /
analyzed: kintu ātma samavāyinaḥ vyavasthā anupapattiḥ  kiñca siddhe vyaktam ekatve syāt api eṣā kalpanā
translated: But the arrangement of those inhering in the self is not possible.🔽Moreover, if the oneness is established, this assumption would be possible.

analyzed: ca ātma ekatve pramāṇam asti  eka puruṣa śrutayaḥ ca prāk eva upavarṇita arthāḥ iti
translated: But there is no proof for the oneness of the self.🔽And the statements about a single person have been described earlier.

analyzed: siddham pratikṣetram nānā bhūtāḥ pumāṃsaḥ iti
translated: Thus it is established that the souls are different in each body.

analyzed: eva śālikānāthena tattvālokaḥ pravartitaḥ
translated: Thus the Tattvâloka has been composed by the lord Shâlikishor.

original: iti mahāmahopādhyāyaśrīśālikanāthamiśrapraṇītāyāṃ prakaraṇapañcikāyāṃ tattvāloko nāmāṣṭamaṃ prakaraṇaṃ samāptam /
analyzed: iti mahā mahā upādhyāya śrī śālikanāthamiśra praṇītāyām prakaraṇa pañcikāyām tattvālokaḥ nāma aṣṭamam prakaraṇam samāptam
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter named Tattvâloka in the Prakaraṇapañcikā composed by the great teacher Shâlikishor Mishra.
